), a large rock which juts straight out from the sea. The rock is a designated nature reserve, but it is possible to climb to the top via a tunnel, bored steeply through the middle of the rock.

value: content=45 min boat trip around the Peñón de Ifach, with underwater view.

takes place every Wednesday in summer months, at Avenida Pais Valencia (next to the Football Stadium). Mostly tat but there are one or two bargains to be found.

value: content=Quite large but crowded. Some good bargains.

The main concentrations of restaurants are around the junctions of C/ Pintor Sorolla and C/ Blasco Ibanez in the town centre; at the harbour (to the east of the rock); and along the beachfront (to the north of the rock).

value: content=Friendly, family-run Chinese restaurant. Good range of traditional dishes and also a sushi selection.
address=C/ Pintor Sorolla; Edf. Apolo IV
hours=1600 until late during the holiday season
content=Good value Italian restaurant. Plenty of tables on the outside terrace. Friendly staff.
content=Great little traditional Tapas Bar. Slightly "school canteen" feel to it but the food and service are both excellent and it is great value.

There are some bars and discos at Calpe's La Fossa-Levante beach, which are well frequented by tourists during summer season.

value: content=Nice and rather large resort. Quite far from the beach though.

can all be reached via the

, which clings to the coast for most of its picturesque journey. You usually have to change in Benidorm if you're continuing to Alicante.

It's also possible to take a boat from the harbour to Dénia, Altea and Benidorm.
